issue.title: Using a short namespace alias results in 500 error

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issues or PR's relating to bugs

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: For new issues/PRs that need to be triaged

issue.body:
### Mautic Version

5.0.x series

### PHP version

8.0.20

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Not relevant

### What happened?

Error 500 when saving a preference center or unsubscribe form in email.

### How can we reproduce this issue?

Step 1: Create or edit email.
Step 2: Set "Unsubscribe feedback form" or "Preference Center Page".
Step 3: Try saving the email.



### Relevant log output

```shell
mautic.CRITICAL: Uncaught PHP Exception Doctrine\ORM\Exception\NotSupported: "Context: Using short namespace alias "MauticPageBundle:Page" when calling Doctrine\ORM\EntityManager::getRepository Problem: Feature was deprecated in doctrine/persistence 2.x and is not supported by installed doctrine/persistence:3.x Solution: See the doctrine/deprecations logs for new alternative approaches." at \vendor\doctrine\orm\lib\Doctrine\ORM\Exception\NotSupported.php line 31 {"exception":"[object] (Doctrine\\ORM\\Exception\\NotSupported(code: 0): Context: Using short namespace alias \"MauticPageBundle:Page\" when calling Doctrine\\ORM\\EntityManager::getRepository\nProblem: Feature was deprecated in doctrine/persistence 2.x and is not supported by installed doctrine/persistence:3.x\nSolution: See the doctrine/deprecations logs for new alternative approaches. at \\vendor\\doctrine\\orm\\lib\\Doctrine\\ORM\\Exception\\NotSupported.php:31)"

mautic.CRITICAL: Uncaught PHP Exception Doctrine\ORM\Exception\NotSupported: "Context: Using short namespace alias "MauticFormBundle:Form" when calling Doctrine\ORM\EntityManager::getRepository Problem: Feature was deprecated in doctrine/persistence 2.x and is not supported by installed doctrine/persistence:3.x Solution: See the doctrine/deprecations logs for new alternative approaches." at \vendor\doctrine\orm\lib\Doctrine\ORM\Exception\NotSupported.php line 31 {"exception":"[object] (Doctrine\\ORM\\Exception\\NotSupported(code: 0): Context: Using short namespace alias \"MauticFormBundle:Form\" when calling Doctrine\\ORM\\EntityManager::getRepository\nProblem: Feature was deprecated in doctrine/persistence 2.x and is not supported by installed doctrine/persistence:3.x\nSolution: See the doctrine/deprecations logs for new alternative approaches. at \\vendor\\doctrine\\orm\\lib\\Doctrine\\ORM\\Exception\\NotSupported.php:31)"
```


### Code of Conduct

- [X] I confirm that I have read and agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct

#### Description:

Add Remain at form on the last possition. Also hide message input If you choose this input

Please write a short README for your feature/bugfix. This will help people understand your PR and what it aims to do. If you are fixing a bug and if there is no linked issue already, please provide steps to reproduce the issue here.

3. Check also If message input is hidden of select option Remain at form

comment.body:
@PatrickJenkner , there are indeed **UX issues** with the form on various fronts:

1. The success message should be positioned at the bottom of the form, below the submit button. In cases where a large form is submitted successfully, users may not realize that the form was submitted because the message is displayed at the top of the page, far from the form.
![image](https://github.com/mautic/mautic/assets/131262825/42fe12a8-4b18-47be-871d-faee582c0095)

2. In the form settings, the "Redirect URL/Message" field is always visible, even if the user doesn't use the associated parameter. A simple solution would be to hide the field when it's not in use and display it only when the user selects parameters that require it.
![image](https://github.com/mautic/mautic/assets/131262825/f89095b6-b23d-4b23-a0b9-2efb1f20c437)

issue.title: Form: Description Area Field > Properties > Description Area. Text not being inserted.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issues or PR's relating to bugs

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: For new issues/PRs that need to be triaged

issue.body: ### Mautic Version 5.0.x series ### PHP version 8.0.2 ### What browsers are you seeing the problem on? Chrome ### What happened? When creating a Description Area field on a form, plain text input is recognized and saved without any issue. However, when attempting to apply formatting such as bold, underline, or quotes, or when copying and pasting text, the changes are not saved, and the field appears empty. Furthermore, when trying to input code using the 'Source' option, it does not function as expected. Interestingly, images are recognized and displayed properly. ![image](https://github.com/mautic/mautic/assets/131262825/683e7539-0cf7-4cd2-9255-836d1192e466) I suspect that this issue may be related to the new text editor being implemented in M5b2. ### How can we reproduce this issue? **Using Source (Code):** Step 1: Navigate to Components > Form Step 2: Create a new form Step 3: Provide a name for the form Step 4: Access the "Fields" section and create a new "Description Area" field. Step 5: Assign a header name to the field. Step 6: Proceed to the "Properties" section. Within the description area, click on "Source." ![image](https://github.com/mautic/mautic/assets/131262825/d1d730d4-8d69-4c23-8365-70c55b055094) Step 7: Copy and paste the following code: `Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.` Step 8: Click "Add" to create the field. The field will appear empty: ![image](https://github.com/mautic/mautic/assets/131262825/13c61e1d-caf3-4314-be6a-3236fcfdfb6e) Step 9 (optional): If you edit the field, go back to the "Properties" section, and you will notice that the text area is empty. ### Relevant log output ```shell None. ``` ### Code of Conduct - [X] I confirm that I have read and agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct

pull_request.title: Add maintenance result to audit log
pull_request.body: | Q | A | -------------------------------------- | --- | Bug fix? (use the a.b branch) | [ ] | New feature/enhancement? (use the a.x branch) | [ ] | Deprecations? | [ ] | BC breaks? (use the c.x branch) | [ ] | Automated tests included? | [ ] | Related user documentation PR URL | mautic/mautic-documentation#... | Related developer documentation PR URL | mautic/developer-documentation#... | Issue(s) addressed | Fixes #... #### Description: Maintenance command clean old data from Mautic https://docs.mautic.org/en/setup/cron-jobs#clean-up-old-data With --gdpr flag remove also contacts without activity older like 3 years. We need summary from maintenance command store to audit log to be sure contact's were deleted from command. #### Steps to test this PR: 1. Load up [this PR](https://mautibox.com) 2. Be sure you you have contacts with last_active older like 3 years ago 3. `run php bin/console mautic:maintenance:cleanup --gdpr` 4. Go to audit_log table and see new log with of summary of command ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/462477/130347755-94061f19-a1a6-4e0f-b7c3-e4fc5b118906.png) `a:2:{s:7:"options";a:3:{s:8:"days-old";i:365;s:4:"gdpr";b:1;s:3:"env";s:3:"dev";}s:5:"stats";a:1:{s:8:"Visitors";i:1;}}`

pull_request.title: Report new columns
pull_request.body:
<!-- ## Which branch should I use for my PR?

Assuming that:

a = current major release
b = current minor release
c = future major release

* a.x for any features and enhancements (e.g. 5.x)
* a.b for any bug fixes (e.g. 4.4, 5.1)
* c.x for any features, enhancements or bug fixes with backward compatibility breaking changes (e.g. 5.x) -->

| Q                                      | A
| -------------------------------------- | ---
| Bug fix? (use the a.b branch)          | 
| New feature/enhancement? (use the a.x branch)      | 🟢 
| Deprecations?                          | 
| BC breaks? (use the c.x branch)        | 
| Automated tests included?              | Not relevant
| Related user documentation PR URL      | 
| Related developer documentation PR URL | 
| Issue(s) addressed                     | 

<!--
Additionally (see https://contribute.mautic.org/contributing-to-mautic/developer/code/pull-requests#work-on-your-pull-request):
 - Always add tests and ensure they pass.
 - Bug fixes must be submitted against the lowest maintained branch where they apply
   (lowest branches are regularly merged to upper ones so they get the fixes too.)
 - Features and deprecations must be submitted against the "4.x" branch.
-->

#### Description:

Added new columns to report section include Data Source to know what kind of report it is

![image](https://github.com/mautic/mautic/assets/462477/68407c56-dbd9-4fef-bbe5-08929849007c)


<!--
Please write a short README for your feature/bugfix. This will help people understand your PR and what it aims to do. If you are fixing a bug and if there is no linked issue already, please provide steps to reproduce the issue here.
-->

#### Steps to test this PR:

<!--
This part is really important. If you want your PR to be merged, take the time to write very clear, annotated and step by step test instructions. Do not assume any previous knowledge - testers may not be developers.
-->
1. Open this PR on Gitpod or pull down for testing locally (see docs on testing PRs [here](https://contribute.mautic.org/contributing-to-mautic/tester))
2.  Go to reports and check  it's OK

<!--
If you have any deprecations, list them here along with the new alternative.
If you have any backwards compatibility breaks, list them here.
-->

pull_request.body:
<!-- ## Which branch should I use for my PR?

Assuming that:

b = current minor release

-->

#### Description:

similar fix as in #12772, there were other places where cloning objects resulted in in 500 errors due to missing `$request` object as first parameter.

This PR fixes this.

pull_request.title: Add support for tokens for SMS
pull_request.body: | Q | A | -------------------------------------- | --- | Bug fix? (use the a.b branch) | [ ] | New feature/enhancement? (use the a.x branch) | [ ] | Deprecations? | [ ] | BC breaks? (use the c.x branch) | [ ] | Automated tests included? | [ ] | Related user documentation PR URL | mautic/mautic-documentation#... | Related developer documentation PR URL | mautic/developer-documentation#... | Issue(s) addressed | Fixes #... #### Description: This PR added support for suggestion tokens similar like you can use in builder ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/462477/150675196-4f5bd3e7-3889-400f-9df0-f33a75273256.png) #### Steps to test this PR: 1. Open this PR on Gitpod or pull down for testing locally (see docs on testing PRs [here](https://contribute.mautic.org/contributing-to-mautic/tester)) 2. On production env need `mautic:assets:generate` 3. On SMS text message field you are able to use `{` + CTRL SPACE to autosuggestion of tokens, included {ownerfield} tokens 4. Then send SMS and see If tokens were replace correctly

Assuming that:

a = current major release
b = current minor release

* a.x for any features and enhancements (e.g. 5.x)
* a.b for any bug fixes (e.g. 4.4, 5.1)
* c.x for any features, enhancements or bug fixes with backward compatibility breaking changes (e.g. 5.x) -->

| Q                                      | A
| -------------------------------------- | ---
| Bug fix? (use the a.b branch)          | [ ]
| New feature/enhancement? (use the a.x branch)      | [ ]
| Deprecations?                          | [ ]
| BC breaks? (use the c.x branch)        | [ ]
| Automated tests included?              | [ ] <!-- All PRs must maintain or improve code coverage -->
| Related user documentation PR URL      | mautic/mautic-documentation#... <!-- required for new features -->
| Related developer documentation PR URL | mautic/developer-documentation#... <!-- required for developer-facing changes -->
| Issue(s) addressed                     | Fixes #... <!-- prefix each issue number with "Fixes #", no need to create an issue if none exists, explain below instead -->

<!--
Additionally (see https://contribute.mautic.org/contributing-to-mautic/developer/code/pull-requests#work-on-your-pull-request):
 - Always add tests and ensure they pass.
 - Bug fixes must be submitted against the lowest maintained branch where they apply
   (lowest branches are regularly merged to upper ones so they get the fixes too.)
 - Features and deprecations must be submitted against the "4.x" branch.
-->

#### Description:

This PR just reorder option for forms Successful Submit Action select box. 
Add Remain at form on the last possition. Also hide message input If you choose this input

<!--
Please write a short README for your feature/bugfix. This will help people understand your PR and what it aims to do. If you are fixing a bug and if there is no linked issue already, please provide steps to reproduce the issue here.
-->

#### Steps to test this PR:

<!--
This part is really important. If you want your PR to be merged, take the time to write very clear, annotated and step by step test instructions. Do not assume any previous knowledge - testers may not be developers.
-->
1. Open this PR on Gitpod or pull down for testing locally (see docs on testing PRs [here](https://contribute.mautic.org/contributing-to-mautic/tester))
2.  Just create form and check If
Message is first option from Successful Submit Action and selected by defaul:
![image](https://github.com/mautic/mautic/assets/462477/e65d9d19-e21c-4612-ae94-0a10ff2fd252)
3. Check also If message input is hidden of select option Remain at form

![image](https://github.com/mautic/mautic/assets/462477/54790d31-1bb2-47ee-b507-cc593184166c)

pull_request.title: Add maintenance result to audit log
pull_request.body: | Q | A | -------------------------------------- | --- | Bug fix? (use the a.b branch) | [ ] | New feature/enhancement? (use the a.x branch) | [ ] | Deprecations? | [ ] | BC breaks? (use the c.x branch) | [ ] | Automated tests included? | [ ] | Related user documentation PR URL | mautic/mautic-documentation#... | Related developer documentation PR URL | mautic/developer-documentation#... | Issue(s) addressed | Fixes #... #### Description: Maintenance command clean old data from Mautic https://docs.mautic.org/en/setup/cron-jobs#clean-up-old-data With --gdpr flag remove also contacts without activity older like 3 years. We need summary from maintenance command store to audit log to be sure contact's were deleted from command. #### Steps to test this PR: 1. Load up [this PR](https://mautibox.com) 2. Be sure you you have contacts with last_active older like 3 years ago 3. `run php bin/console mautic:maintenance:cleanup --gdpr` 4. Go to audit_log table and see new log with of summary of command ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/462477/130347755-94061f19-a1a6-4e0f-b7c3-e4fc5b118906.png) `a:2:{s:7:"options";a:3:{s:8:"days-old";i:365;s:4:"gdpr";b:1;s:3:"env";s:3:"dev";}s:5:"stats";a:1:{s:8:"Visitors";i:1;}}`

PR added support language for forms. 
You can use translations for validate default message and please wait message

3.  Try submit

issue.body:
<!-- ## Which branch should I use for my PR?

Assuming that:

a = current major release
b = current minor release
c = future major release

* a.x for any features and enhancements (e.g. 5.x)
* a.b for any bug fixes (e.g. 4.4, 5.1)
* c.x for any features, enhancements or bug fixes with backward compatibility breaking changes (e.g. 5.x) -->

| Q                                      | A
| -------------------------------------- | ---
| Bug fix? (use the a.b branch)          | [ ]
| New feature/enhancement? (use the a.x branch)      | [ ]
| Deprecations?                          | [ ]
| BC breaks? (use the c.x branch)        | [ ]
| Automated tests included?              | [ ] <!-- All PRs must maintain or improve code coverage -->
| Related user documentation PR URL      | mautic/mautic-documentation#... <!-- required for new features -->
| Related developer documentation PR URL | mautic/developer-documentation#... <!-- required for developer-facing changes -->
| Issue(s) addressed                     | Fixes #... <!-- prefix each issue number with "Fixes #", no need to create an issue if none exists, explain below instead -->

<!--
Additionally (see https://contribute.mautic.org/contributing-to-mautic/developer/code/pull-requests#work-on-your-pull-request):
 - Always add tests and ensure they pass.
 - Bug fixes must be submitted against the lowest maintained branch where they apply
   (lowest branches are regularly merged to upper ones so they get the fixes too.)
 - Features and deprecations must be submitted against the "4.x" branch.
-->

#### Description:
If the page contains a consent window, then it's impossible to use a popup or notification.  
There is on click event that closes it after clicking anywhere. We removed it and now it's possible to close the modal just with the cross button. 

<!--
Please write a short README for your feature/bugfix. This will help people understand your PR and what it aims to do. If you are fixing a bug and if there is no linked issue already, please provide steps to reproduce the issue here.
-->

#### Steps to test this PR:

<!--
This part is really important. If you want your PR to be merged, take the time to write very clear, annotated and step by step test instructions. Do not assume any previous knowledge - testers may not be developers.
-->
1. Open this PR on Gitpod or pull down for testing locally (see docs on testing PRs [here](https://contribute.mautic.org/contributing-to-mautic/tester))
2. Add consent window to the page to confirm cookie
3. Create notification and put it to the page
4. If you click on the consent cookie window, then the notification is closed too.
5. After PR you are able to close it just on cross button in notification

<!--
If you have any deprecations, list them here along with the new alternative.
If you have any backwards compatibility breaks, list them here.
-->

comment.body: @RCheesley Not possible to add unit tests, it's a JS change

(use the c.x branch) | [ ] | Automated tests included? | [ ] | Related user documentation PR URL | mautic/mautic-documentation#... | Related developer documentation PR URL | mautic/developer-documentation#... | Issue(s) addressed | Fixes #... #### Description: This PR added support for suggestion tokens similar like you can use in builder ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/462477/150675196-4f5bd3e7-3889-400f-9df0-f33a75273256.png) #### Steps to test this PR: 1. Open this PR on Gitpod or pull down for testing locally (see docs on testing PRs [here](https://contribute.mautic.org/contributing-to-mautic/tester)) 2. On production env need `mautic:assets:generate` 3. On SMS text message field you are able to use `{` + CTRL SPACE to autosuggestion of tokens, included {ownerfield} tokens 4. Then send SMS and see If tokens were replace correctly

comment.body:
@atowne-mautic good point. I added it below the text

![image](https://github.com/mautic/mautic/assets/462477/9327b4d4-fa01-4027-89c8-9900ff7abaf6)

review.body: The clone bug is Mautic 5 and not this PR (see https://github.com/mautic/mautic/issues/12830) so this PR is good to go 🚀 🎉

issue.body:
<!-- ## Which branch should I use for my PR?

Assuming that:

a = current major release
b = current minor release
c = future major release

* a.x for any features and enhancements (e.g. 5.x)
* a.b for any bug fixes (e.g. 4.4, 5.1)
* c.x for any features, enhancements or bug fixes with backward compatibility breaking changes (e.g. 5.x) -->

| Q                                      | A
| -------------------------------------- | ---
| Bug fix? (use the a.b branch)          | [ ]
| New feature/enhancement? (use the a.x branch)      | [ ]
| Deprecations?                          | [ ]
| BC breaks? (use the c.x branch)        | [ ]
| Automated tests included?              | [ ] <!-- All PRs must maintain or improve code coverage -->
| Related user documentation PR URL      | mautic/mautic-documentation#... <!-- required for new features -->
| Related developer documentation PR URL | mautic/developer-documentation#... <!-- required for developer-facing changes -->
| Issue(s) addressed                     | Fixes #... <!-- prefix each issue number with "Fixes #", no need to create an issue if none exists, explain below instead -->

<!--
Additionally (see https://contribute.mautic.org/contributing-to-mautic/developer/code/pull-requests#work-on-your-pull-request):
 - Always add tests and ensure they pass.
 - Bug fixes must be submitted against the lowest maintained branch where they apply
   (lowest branches are regularly merged to upper ones so they get the fixes too.)
 - Features and deprecations must be submitted against the "4.x" branch.
-->

#### Description:

This PR just reorder option for forms Successful Submit Action select box. 
Add Remain at form on the last possition. Also hide message input If you choose this input

<!--
Please write a short README for your feature/bugfix. This will help people understand your PR and what it aims to do. If you are fixing a bug and if there is no linked issue already, please provide steps to reproduce the issue here.
-->

#### Steps to test this PR:

<!--
This part is really important. If you want your PR to be merged, take the time to write very clear, annotated and step by step test instructions. Do not assume any previous knowledge - testers may not be developers.
-->
1. Open this PR on Gitpod or pull down for testing locally (see docs on testing PRs [here](https://contribute.mautic.org/contributing-to-mautic/tester))
2.  Just create form and check If
Message is first option from Successful Submit Action and selected by defaul:
![image](https://github.com/mautic/mautic/assets/462477/e65d9d19-e21c-4612-ae94-0a10ff2fd252)
3. Check also If message input is hidden of select option Remain at form

![image](https://github.com/mautic/mautic/assets/462477/54790d31-1bb2-47ee-b507-cc593184166c)



<!--
If you have any deprecations, list them here along with the new alternative.
If you have any backwards compatibility breaks, list them here.
-->

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -158,6 +158,7 @@ mautic.widget.unique.vs.returning.leads="Unique vs returning visitors"
 mautic.widget.dwell.times="Dwell times"
 mautic.widget.popular.pages="Popular landing pages"
 mautic.widget.created.pages="Created Landing pages"
+mautic.widget.best.tracking.pages="Best tracking pages"
comment.body: These stats come from tracked pages with tracking codes. I suggest using combination tracked pages to determine differences to landing pages. Other suggestions are ok to me.

pull_request.title: Dashboard widget: Best tracking pages
pull_request.body:
<!-- ## Which branch should I use for my PR?

Assuming that:

a = current major release
b = current minor release
c = future major release

* a.x for any features and enhancements (e.g. 5.x)
* a.b for any bug fixes (e.g. 4.4, 5.1)
* c.x for any features, enhancements or bug fixes with backward compatibility breaking changes (e.g. 5.x) -->

| Q                                      | A
| -------------------------------------- | ---
| Bug fix? (use the a.b branch)          | [ ]
| New feature/enhancement? (use the a.x branch)      | [ ]
| Deprecations?                          | [ ]
| BC breaks? (use the c.x branch)        | [ ]
| Automated tests included?              | [ ] <!-- All PRs must maintain or improve code coverage -->
| Related user documentation PR URL      | mautic/mautic-documentation#... <!-- required for new features -->
| Related developer documentation PR URL | mautic/developer-documentation#... <!-- required for developer-facing changes -->
| Issue(s) addressed                     | Fixes #... <!-- prefix each issue number with "Fixes #", no need to create an issue if none exists, explain below instead -->

<!--
Additionally (see https://contribute.mautic.org/contributing-to-mautic/developer/code/pull-requests#work-on-your-pull-request):
 - Always add tests and ensure they pass.
 - Bug fixes must be submitted against the lowest maintained branch where they apply
   (lowest branches are regularly merged to upper ones so they get the fixes too.)
 - Features and deprecations must be submitted against the "4.x" branch.
-->

[//]: # ( Required: )
#### Description:
This PR added best tracking page for as dashboard widget

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/462477/54059317-f931dc00-41f8-11e9-90a7-711e8c179783.png)

#### Steps to test this PR:
1. Apply PR on Mautic instance with a lot of page hits
2. Then add dashboard widget - Best tracking pages
3. Chcek If stats are related to your expection
